front.title: A Recommendation for IPv6 Address Text Representation

abstract.t: As IPv6 network grows, there will be more engineers and also non-engineers who will have the need to use an IPv6 address in text.While the IPv6 address architecture RFC 4291 section 2.2 depicts aflexible model for text representation of an IPv6 address, thisflexibility has been causing problems for operators, systemengineers, and customers. This document will describe the problemsthat a flexible text representation has been causing. This documentalso recommends a canonical representation format that best avoidsconfusion. It is expected that the canonical format is followed byhumans and systems when generating an address to represent as text,but all implementations must accept any legitimate RFC4291 format.
